description.narrative: Enhanced national systems that govern the volume, efficiency and impact of invested resources towards building resilience of the most vulnerable boys, girls and adolescents., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the lifecycle, and building their resilience, through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies on the basis of adequately disaggregated data on children.

title.narrative: Enhanced national systems that govern the volume, efficiency and impact of invested resources towards building resilience of the most vulnerable boys, girls and adolescents.

description.narrative: ECA enhanced the enabling environment of national budgeting and expenditure for investments in children and support initiatives to refine delivery of cash and social transfers, with an equity focus, ensuring effective management of national resources to reach the poor most vulnerable populations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children
Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
